title: Gost ms
author: Gost ms
content: Malaysia is the first country in the world to include digital currency or Bitcoin in Zakat. All Muslim individuals who invest in Bitcoin. It has been determined that they will have to pay 2.5 percent Zakat at the end of the year from the amount they invest.https://www.thedailystar.net/tech-startup/news/malaysia-allows-crypto-zakat-payments-3804951For Malaysian Muslims, Bitcoin is considered a halal digital currency from an Islamic perspective. There are many Muslim brothers and sisters who think that Bitcoin is forbidden from an Islamic perspective. For this reason, many are not willing to invest in Bitcoin. But Malaysia is the first country in the world to include Bitcoin in Zakat.

comments.author: HelliumZ
comments.body: There is controversy over how Islamic scholars issue fatwas on paying zakat via Bitcoin. In Islamic terminology, Bitcoin is considered a prohibited currency, and therefore Zakat cannot be paid through Bitcoin. Moreover, gambling platforms directly support Bitcoin, which is considered a reprehensible and reprehensible act in Islamic terms, so there is doubt as to whether Zakat can ever be exchanged through Bitcoin. However, if Bitcoin is used purely as a currency and is accepted as a medium of exchange for all purposes, then there is no doubt that Zakat can be paid.

comments.author: Shadiq
comments.body: Quote from: HelliumZ on February 17, 2025, 01:15:19 PMThere is controversy over how Islamic scholars issue fatwas on paying zakat via Bitcoin. In Islamic terminology, Bitcoin is considered a prohibited currency, and therefore Zakat cannot be paid through Bitcoin. Moreover, gambling platforms directly support Bitcoin, which is considered a reprehensible and reprehensible act in Islamic terms, so there is doubt as to whether Zakat can ever be exchanged through Bitcoin. However, if Bitcoin is used purely as a currency and is accepted as a medium of exchange for all purposes, then there is no doubt that Zakat can be paid.Why are you confusing the issue? There is a difference between paying Zakat through Bitcoin and paying Zakat on Bitcoin. Of course, people who are entitled to Zakat will not accept Bitcoin or want to accept it, because they need cash and such a poor (more) person will not be an educated person who knows Bitcoin and how to use Bitcoin. Maybe some people may agree to accept Bitcoin.Suppose, it is obligatory for you to pay Zakat on your land. If you want to pay Zakat, will you give your land to a poor person as Zakat? Of course not. You have to pay 2.5% of the value of your land as Zakat to the poor. You can consider Bitcoin in the same way. You must set aside and pay Zakat on 2.5% of your total Bitcoin holdings, equal to the Bitcoin equivalent value or equivalent amount. For example, if you own 100 Bitcoins with a market value of approximately $10,000,000 (assuming an exchange rate of $100k), then you must pay Zakat on 2.5 Bitcoins with a market value of $250,000. This means you must pay this amount in fiat.
